首先,
to see that bayes rule determines beliefs at the B information set note that 0.9/(0.1+9)=0.9 依個係咪姐係strong 同weak 會choose b 既pr 因為for strong choose b 3>2, 1>0. for weak, 2<3, 0<1.
所以(0.9+0)/0.1+0.9

不用理會payoffs。
點apply Bayes rule? 因為個assessment已經話你知both type of Player 1 choose B
對Player 2來說，B這個information set is reached with probability 1 (total probability = 0.1+0.9)，而佢知道自已係圖上B information set左邊個node的機會咪0.9/1 = 0.9, 知道係右邊個node的機會係0.1/1 = 0.1

同理, Q這個information set is reached with probability 0，因為Player 1在指定的assessment不用玩Q, 所以你用唔到Bayes rule (so beliefs are unrestricted)

Example: 假設有另一個strategy: Strong type plays B, weak type plays Q, 咁B information set is reached with prob. = Pr(Strong)* Pr(Strong type plays B) = 0.9* 1 =0.9, 而呢個係唯一去到B information set的方法, 所以Bayes rule: 0.9/0.9 = 1。直覺係: 因為player 2 預期只有strong type會玩B, 所以見到的B一定係由strong type黎, 所以一旦見到B, player 2知道佢一定係B information set左邊的node。

小結: Apply Bayes rule永遠係given strategy, strategy不用理是否optimal/equilibrium, given 的strategy 係指定由nature出發, 個play經過每條branch的機會, 再reach information set然後update。


第二句:To see sequential rationality consider player 2 first. Since U2(N ¦ B) = 0.9 > 0.1 = U2(F ¦ B)
U2(N/B) 要係下面average Payoff for N:1X0.9+0=0.9
U2(F/B) 要係下面average Payoff for N:0+1x0.1=0.1
所以U2(N ¦ B) = 0.9 > 0.1 = U2(F ¦ B)
但問題黎啦.player 2 點知自己playoff?佢都睇唔到types of play 1 既probabilty.
唔係應該係Player2 知道Player 1 佢簡B後,佢就估到Player 1 係strong type?

道理正係Bayesian updating度黎。Player 2見到 player 1揀B於是bayesian updates。第一段的result係: Pr(Strong|B) = 0.9 (B information set 左邊的node) and Pr(Weak|B) = 0.1 (右邊node)
咁by definition: U2(N|B) =Pr(Strong|B)* 1 + Pr(Weak|B) * 0
由此類推。
Follow Example: Pr(Strong|B)=1, 因為player 2知道佢係左邊, 玩N一定攞1: U2(N|B) = 1*1 + 0*0 = 1。


之後下句:
It can be shown that as far as the belief that player 1 is week upon observing Q is week is at least ½, then playing F is optimal given Q
依句應該係P1估P2估P1 係咩TYPE?
given Q 姐係上面,U2F>U2N
當weak 係p,strong 係1-p, p>1-p,p>1/2
所以佢會係p>1/2 情況下簡F given Q

計算係岩。More precisely, 你的p 係 p =Pr(Weak|Q),
所以 U2(F|Q) = p* 1 + (1-p)*0
但因為Q is reached with zero probability，p可以係咩數字都得, 而只要p>= 1/2, U2(F|Q)>= U2(N|Q)。


Finally we verify that player 1 prefer to play B when it is both weak and strong. This is obvious as the payoffs from playing B are 2 and 3 respectively, versus the payoffs from playing Q which are 1 and 0 respectively.
